    check_if_last_char_is_a_letter("") ➞ False

    groups = ["a", "b", "c", "d", "e", "f", "g", "h"]
    # characters that are not in a word and are not in a group
    spaces = ["a", "b", "c", "d", "e", "f", "g", "h"]

    # check that the last character is not a word
    if not txt.endswith(' '):
        return False
    last_char = txt[len(txt)-len(words=groups):]
    # check if the last character is not a word
    if not last_char.endswith(' '):
        return False
    last_char = last_char.replace(words=groups, spaces=spaces)
    return last_char == last_char
